turns.content:
Organize this as an outline for the YouTube video titled "The Most Savage Fighter in MMA - Nate Diaz"

introduce the fighter and his fighting name / qualities and fightstyle explanation. 
. Show and explain where he grew up , how he got into the fighting sports. Let the viewer dive into his fighting history
o show throughout the video the beginning of his career and other organizations where he fought before the ufc.
u first see his early fights for other fighting organisations step by step till the UFC.
The voice over can join the fight as one of the commentators and take us further in the fight. by talking about beautiful strikes that get landed or received. make it exciting for the viewers At the end of the fight always show who won the fight
Show footage of his training and trainingcamp, so you can see him prepare for his next fight
When the voice-over is talking about his next fight and talks about who he will be fighting show the Staredowns And -
Introduce the fighter his opponent and show a little highlights of the opponent to make him look more dangerous and take the viewers with you into the fight and the fighter his journey
Grab some info about main fighter his opponents Always show who won the fight.

Outline:

I. Introduction

* Introduce Nate Diaz and his fighting name
* Explanation of his fighting style and qualities

II. Early Life and Fighting History

* Where he grew up and how he got into fighting
* Early fights in other organizations before joining UFC

III. UFC Career

* Show and explain early fights in UFC
* Voice-over commentary of key moments in fights
* Footage of training and preparation for fights

IV. Opponents and Fights

* Introduce opponents and show highlights to build up excitement for fights
* Staredowns before fights
* Recap of who won each fight

V. Conclusion

* Recap of Nate Diaz's career and achievements as a fighter

Keeping in mind the above outline, Write on I and II. Use this as context if required, don't say welcome, instead get right to the point:

Nathan Donald Diaz (born April 16, 1985) is an American professional mixed martial artist who is currently a free agent. Diaz is most known for his time spent fighting in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), where he fought for over 15 years after winning The Ultimate Fighter 5 Prior to signing with the UFC, Diaz competed in World Extreme Cagefighting, Strikeforce, and Pancrase. Diaz has the third most UFC bonus awards, with 16 in total.[6]

Background
The son of Melissa (née Womble) and Robert Diaz, he was born of Mexican and Anglo heritage and raised in Stockton, California with his brother Nick and sister Nina.[7][8] He attended Tokay High School and, at the age of 11, he began training in martial arts with his brother, Nick.

Nate Diaz is a professional mixed martial artist known for his time in the UFC. Before joining the UFC, Diaz competed in World Extreme Cagefighting, Strikeforce, and Pancrase. He has the third highest number of UFC bonus awards, with 16 in total. Born and raised in Stockton, California, Diaz comes from a mixed Mexican and Anglo heritage and began training in martial arts with his brother, Nick, at the age of 11.

Analyze this writing and rewrite the above in similar format to it:

Meet Zabit Magomedsharipov, also known as "ZaBeast" in the UFC world. This Russian mixed martial artist has made a name for himself with his dynamic and flashy fighting style, incorporating elements of traditional martial arts and acrobatics. With a professional record of 22 wins and only one loss, Magomedsharipov has proven to be a formidable force in the featherweight division.

Magomedsharipov began his martial arts journey at a young age, starting with freestyle wrestling and sanda. He later joined the Wushu boarding school Pyat Storon Sveta, where he lived and trained for many years. At the school, he trained in a variety of disciplines, including judo, sambo, wrestling, and Brazilian jiu-jitsu, under the guidance of Gusein Magomaev.

Throughout his time at the boarding school, Magomedsharipov dedicated himself to becoming a well-rounded martial artist, and he achieved numerous notable achievements in various disciplines. In 2012, he made his professional mixed martial arts debut and began to make a name for himself in regional Russian promotions.

Nate Diaz is a professional mixed martial artist known for his time in the UFC. He has a reputation for his dynamic and exciting fighting style, incorporating elements of traditional martial arts and acrobatics. Diaz has a successful record of wins in the UFC, with the third highest number of bonus awards at 16. He was raised in Stockton, California and began training in martial arts with his brother at the age of 11. Before joining the UFC, Diaz competed in World Extreme Cagefighting, Strikeforce, and Pancrase.
Write up to 200 words of above writing

Nathan Donald Diaz, also known as Nate Diaz, is a professional mixed martial artist with a long history in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). He is known for his unique and aggressive fighting style, incorporating elements of traditional martial arts and acrobatics. With a strong track record in the UFC, Diaz has won a total of 16 bonus awards, making him one of the most successful fighters in the organization.

Diaz was raised in Stockton, California and began training in martial arts at a young age with his brother. Before joining the UFC, he had already gained experience competing in other organizations such as World Extreme Cagefighting, Strikeforce, and Pancrase. In these organizations, Diaz developed his skills and established a reputation as a formidable opponent.

Throughout his career, Diaz has faced some of the toughest opponents in the UFC and has consistently proven himself as a skilled and determined fighter. His dedication to training and preparation has allowed him to achieve numerous victories, cementing his place as one of the most respected and feared fighters in the sport. Whether in the octagon or in the gym, Diaz continues to push himself to be the best fighter he can be, always striving for improvement and success.

Write on II from outline, use this as context if required:
Early career
Prior to his official MMA career, Diaz competed in a bare knuckle MMA fight against Robert Limon on July 20, 2002, at the age of 17. Footage has since emerged of the fight and it is believed to be his first competitive experience.[9]

Upon making his official professional MMA debut, Diaz competed mainly for World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC). In 2006, at WEC 24, he fought for the WEC Lightweight Championship against then-champion Hermes França, losing by submission in the second round. This was the last event held by WEC before it was acquired by Zuffa, LLC, then parent company of the UFC.

Nate Diaz's professional mixed martial arts career began with a bare knuckle fight against Robert Limon in 2002, when he was just 17 years old. After this, he mainly competed in the World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC) organization. In 2006, Diaz fought for the WEC Lightweight Championship against Hermes França at WEC 24, but ultimately lost by submission in the second round. This was the final event held by the WEC before it was purchased by the UFC's parent company, Zuffa, LLC.

Nate Diaz's professional mixed martial arts career began before he even turned 18 years old. In July 2002, he participated in a bare knuckle fight against Robert Limon, which is believed to be his first competitive experience in the sport. Footage of the fight has since emerged, showcasing Diaz's natural talent and determination even at such a young age.

After this fight, Diaz began competing in the World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC) organization, where he quickly made a name for himself as a formidable opponent. In 2006, he had the opportunity to fight for the WEC Lightweight Championship against Hermes França at WEC 24. Despite his best efforts, Diaz was ultimately defeated by submission in the second round. This defeat was a setback, but it did not deter Diaz from continuing to pursue his dreams in the sport.

This fight was also significant because it marked the last event held by the WEC before it was acquired by Zuffa, LLC, the parent company of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). This acquisition would eventually lead to Diaz joining the UFC and competing at the highest level of mixed martial arts. Despite the challenges he faced early on in his career, Diaz's perseverance and dedication to the sport have allowed him to become one of the most respected and successful fighters in the UFC.
Write on III from outline. MAKE IT LONG

Nate Diaz's time in the UFC has been marked by a series of exciting and memorable fights. After joining the organization following the acquisition of the World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC) by the UFC's parent company, Zuffa, LLC, Diaz quickly made a name for himself as a formidable opponent.

One of Diaz's earliest fights in the UFC was against Marcus Davis at UFC 118 in 2010. This bout ended in a split decision victory for Diaz, and marked the beginning of his successful career in the organization. Over the next several years, Diaz faced off against a variety of opponents, consistently demonstrating his skills and determination in the octagon.

Some of Diaz's most notable fights in the UFC include his victory over Conor McGregor at UFC 196 in 2016, and his rematch against McGregor at UFC 202 in the same year. These highly publicized and highly anticipated bouts drew widespread attention and cemented Diaz's place as a top contender in the sport.

In addition to his impressive record in the UFC, Diaz has also earned a total of 16 bonus awards, making him one of the most successful fighters in the organization. His dedication to training and preparation, as well as his unique and aggressive fighting style, have allowed him to consistently perform at the highest level and achieve numerous victories.
